title: How to Build a Dry Wall Partition for Your House

steps.headline: Determine what kind of plasterboard you´ll need.
steps.description: White plasterboard is not water resistant but very cheap. Blue or green plasterboard is water resistant but costs 2-3 times more.

steps.headline: Draw a straight line on the floor or on the place where are you going to build your wall.
Cut wood for the frame and assemble it, using a screwdriver.
steps.description: You can use a permanent adhesive but it's not recommended, if you want to be able to remove the dry wall later.

steps.headline: Screw the plasterboard on the frame.
Add insulation to your wall, if you want.
steps.description: Just cut it to the right size and place it inside your frame. Make sure to get the right type of insulation, depending on what you need: heat or noise or both.

steps.headline: Plaster your wall or just cover it with some paper.
